gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 6,41]]The Jews murmured about him because he said, "I am the bread that came down from heaven,"
[[Jn 6,42]]and they said, "Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph? Do we not know his father and mother? Then how can he say, 'I have come down from heaven'?"
[[Jn 6,43]]Jesus answered and said to them, "Stop murmuring among yourselves.
[[Jn 6,44]]No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draw him, and I will raise him on the last day.
[[Jn 6,45]]It is written in the prophets: 'They shall all be taught by God.' Everyone who listens to my Father and learns from him comes to me.
[[Jn 6,46]]Not that anyone has seen the Father except the one who is from God; he has seen the Father.
[[Jn 6,47]]Amen, amen, I say to you, whoever believes has eternal life.
[[Jn 6,48]]I am the bread of life.
[[Jn 6,49]]Your ancestors ate the manna in the desert, but they died;
[[Jn 6,50]]this is the bread that comes down from heaven so that one may eat it and not die.
[[Jn 6,51]]I am the living bread that came down from heaven; whoever eats this bread will live forever; and the bread that I will give is my flesh for the life of the world."

second_reading.title: Letter to the Ephesians
second_reading.text:
[[Ep 4,30]]Brothers and sisters: Do not grieve the holy Spirit of God, with which you were sealed for the day of redemption.
[[Ep 4,31]]All bitterness, fury, anger, shouting, and reviling must be removed from you, along with all malice.
[[Ep 4,32]](And) be kind to one another, compassionate, forgiving one another as God has forgiven you in Christ.
[[Ep 5,1]]So be imitators of God, as beloved children,
[[Ep 5,2]]and live in love, as Christ loved us and handed himself over for us as a sacrificial offering to God for a fragrant aroma.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 34,2]]I will bless the LORD at all times; 
his praise shall be ever in my mouth.
[[Ps 34,3]]Let my soul glory in the LORD; 
the lowly will hear me and be glad.

[[Ps 34,4]]Glorify the LORD with me, 
let us together extol his name.
[[Ps 34,5]]I sought the LORD, and he answered me 
and delivered me from all my fears.

[[Ps 34,6]]Look to him that you may be radiant with joy, 
and your faces may not blush with shame.
[[Ps 34,7]]When the poor one called out, the LORD heard, 
and from all his distress he saved him.

[[Ps 34,8]]The angel of the LORD encamps 
around those who fear him, and delivers them.
[[Ps 34,9]]Taste and see how good the LORD is; 
blessed the man who takes refuge in him.

first_reading.title: 1st book of Kings
first_reading.text:
[[1_R 19,4]]Elijah went a day's journey into the desert, until he came to a broom tree and sat beneath it. He prayed for death: "This is enough, O LORD! Take my life, for I am no better than my fathers."
[[1_R 19,5]]He lay down and fell asleep under the broom tree, but then an angel touched him and ordered him to get up and eat.
[[1_R 19,6]]He looked and there at his head was a hearth cake and a jug of water. After he ate and drank, he lay down again,
[[1_R 19,7]]but the angel of the LORD came back a second time, touched him, and ordered, "Get up and eat, else the journey will be too long for you!"
[[1_R 19,8]]He got up, ate and drank; then strengthened by that food, he walked forty days and forty nights to the mountain of God, Horeb.
